comment._content: I think this is a mistranscription of the middle initial and a misspelling of the last name, and this is a picture of Mrs. John H. (Herbert) Ballantine. Her husband (1864-1946) was a grandson of Peter Ballantine, who founded the famous brewery, Peter Ballantine & Sons, in Newark, New Jersey . After leaving the brewery business, he moved to the Neptune Meter Co. and became president. There were two Mrs. John H. Ballantines. He married the first , Lois Wilgus Ballantine, in 1890. She died on December 24, 1919. I'm guessing that is who is pictured here. books.google.com/books?id=S5E-AAAAYAAJ&pg=PA1066&... The second Mrs. B. was Gertrude Drake Ballantine (1869-1958). There was a son, John Holme Ballantine, from the first marriage, born 1892. It is possible this is his wife, as this seems to be a much younger woman than Lois Ballantine must have been in 1915, after 25 years of marriage.
